intro: Macleania talamancensis, commonly known as the Talamancan mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests. It has opposite, elliptical leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
